verbs.description: [ARG0: ireland vote on blasphemy] [ARGM-EXT: further] [V: removes] [ARG1: it] [ARG2: from its catholic rootsireland vote on blasphemy] further removes it from its catholic roots a medieval crime that was crowbarred into ireland statute books will now be scrapped thanks to a weekend referendum which saw around 70 percent voting to eliminate the criminal offence of blasphemy among the many celebrating the result was chairperson of atheist ireland michael nugent in a post on the department of justice united nations band stephen fry colm o’gorman catholic church united nations atheist ireland osce executive director of amnesty ireland republic of ireland venice commission united nations human rights committee council of europe ireland irish government amnesty ireland michael nugent
